answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems.  Apart from HIV testing, you must test for herpes, and other STDs including syphilis. If are having recurrent skin problems then it can also be dermatitis, fungal infection, psoriasis and eczema. All this can raise your lymphocyte count.Also, chronic stress can cause skin eruptions especially if you have diabetes or hypothyroidism.Since a confirmed diagnosis cannot be given on net please consult your doctor regarding this. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: Sir/Madam,I am 23 year software professional. I had unprotected sex 1year 10months ago with prostitute.It was my misfortune that condom ruptured. Since then I am suffering from fatigue ,exhaustion ,weakness ,reoccuring skin problems which I never had .Also some times low grade fever.Under eye dark circles.I have got tested for hiv for almost 12 times in which my recent test was Combo test which I undertook on 21 Oct 2013 whose result is negative(0.14).Before that I had undergone HIV Combo 4 times--->3rd month,4th month,9th month,13th month post exposure,PCR DNA 2 times--->36 days,4th month post exposure,Tridot 4 times---->19 days,4th month,5th month,6 month post exposure.All tests were Negative.Yesterday I did CBC test in which everything was normal except Absolute Lymphocyte count 3444 abnormal(normal 1000-3000) according to lab report.Also Lymphocyte percentage 41% (normal is 20-40%)I am completely tierd of all this things happening with me.Please help me and suggest me what I should do. Am I hiv negative? Is there any other disorder in me?As abnormal Lymphocyte suggest viral infection.Please suggest...
title: Worried due to abnormal Lympocyte count
